body.p: The Board found it difficult to identify a practical method for identifying the change in the fair value of plan assets that arises from the passage of time, particularly for assets that do not bear explicit interest. The Board rejected approximations to this amount using:

li.p: the expected return on plan assets (as required by IAS 19 before the amendments made in 2011) because it could not be determined in an objective way, and because it might include a return that is not simply attributable to the passage of time; and
dividends (but not capital gains) received on equity plan assets and interest earned on debt plan assets. In the Board’s view, dividends are not a faithful representation of the time value of money.
